post.author: 나수환
post.content:
저에게 날아온 이메일입니다.
참조하시고 응모?
직장을 찾는 모든분...아자!!!
(아빠, 힘내세요!..우리가 있잔아요~~~)




Position: Mainframe and Unix Operator
Mandatory Skills: Mainframe & Unix
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Location: Toronto
Duration: 6 month
Rate/Salary: Negotiable
Start Date: ASAP
Job Description:
PRIMARY DUTIES:

1. A) Starts up computer systems and schedules batch or on-line
applications according to defined standards and procedures.
B) Sets up job controls, input files, back-up files and output
files for jobs to be executed.
C) Monitors operation of on-line communications network and
initiates corrective action as required.
D) Monitors operation of all software packages and initiates
corrective action as required.
2. Executes jobs as per computer schedule and on request, as
determined by the Operations Manager.
3. Monitors jobs during execution and takes corrective action as
required for successful job completion as defined in Operating
Instructions. Escalates problem situations to appropriate
levels as required.
4. Records controls in respective logs.
5. Prints, bursts and decollates output as required.
6. Separates, identifies and puts output in I/O distribution area.
7. Performs housekeeping maintenance on all peripheral devices.
8. Records system activity with special reporting for system
problem/failures.
9. Calls Customer Support in the event of hardware failure, and
escalates to appropriate levels as required.
10. Maintains a neat and orderly equipment area as defined in
Operations Standards.
11. Maintains an orderly tape library.
12. Makes minor job control changes as required from time-to-time to
recover from production interruptions.
13. Receives computer forms and stocks same in storage area.
14. Maintains orderly files of Systems Department file copy of job
output.
15. Assists Applications Development staff in making minor JCL
changes or corrections from time-to-time in the absence of the
Operations Analyst, and assists with the processing of development Staff's testing.
16. Records and documents incidents in a detailed fashion to
support process and escalation.
17. Acts as service desk (3707) during off hours and weekends.
18. Other duties as requested or required.
II MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
1. University degree/College Diploma in related discipline.
2. Specialized training in computer operations.
3. Four years' work related experience.
4. Ability to work under minimum supervision.
5. Good oral and written communication skills.
6. Self-starter.
The environment is basically as follows:
1. IBM Mainframe Machine Type 2066 running Z/OS (300 MIPS) with multiple LPARS
2. IBM 3494 Tape Silo (RMM)
3. IBM 2105 DASD Storage Shark
4. 130 Servers (Rack Mounted) comprising of High Availability Clustered
Environments using both Unix Sun Solaris 7.0 and 8.0, Windows
2000 and Windows NT
5. Veritas Netbackup 5.0 for Server backups
6. TWS -OPC Job scheduler
7. DB2 & CICS
8. INFOPAC
We would like to thank you for your interest. Please note that all submissions will be assessed. However, only suitable candidates will be contacted further.
Please submit your most recent resume to: Jean-Francois Bourgeois

jfb@procom.ca
post.title: Mainframe and Unix Operator
